text: The Big Smoke (1959) is a novel by Australian writer D'Arcy Niland.Austlit - The Big Smoke by D'Arcy Niland ==Plot summary== Set in Sydney in the early part of the twentieth century, the novel is a series of stories told from the perspective of people associated with the son of an indigenous boxer, Chiddy Hay. ==Critical reception== On its original publication in the USA Kirkus Review found: "The conglomerate that makes up a big city, from aboriginal to white, evil to good, and youth to age, has a sense of panorama, always colored by the Big Smoke, which is seen and recorded with observant detail.""The Big Smoke by D'Arcy Niland", Kirkus Review, 31 May 1961 == Notes == * Dedication: For Ruth == See also == * 1959 in Australian literature ==References== Category:1959 Australian novels Category:Angus & Robertson books Category:Novels set in Sydney
title: The Big Smoke (novel)
